meanings.definition: An ornament at the top of a spire, gable, or similar structure.
meanings.sent1: The golden finial sparkled in the sunlight atop the church spire.
meanings.sent2: The finial on the roof of the tower added an elegant touch to the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the finial of the house, thinking it was a nut.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams reached as high as the finial on the castle, aiming for the stars.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the finial made it a memorable feature of the architecture.

meanings.definition: A decorative knob or other terminal feature at the top of an object.
meanings.sent1: The antique dresser had a beautiful finial on top of its mirror.
meanings.sent2: She carefully dusted the finial on the lamp, making sure it shone brightly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted at the finial on the vase, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: His ideas always had a finial of creativity that set them apart from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The finial on the clock was so intricate, it seemed to tell its own story.

meanings.definition: A decorative element at the end of a curtain rod.
meanings.sent1: The finial on the curtain rod matched the room's elegant decor perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the finial on the curtain rod to ensure the drapes hung straight.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the finial on the curtain rod was a magic wand.
meanings.sent4: The finial on the curtain rod held the fabric in place like a crown on a king.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the finial made it a focal point of the window dressing.
